TopicTitle: Show off your awesome KSP Pictures-Presented By Venku Rocketry International

Articles.Content: Most people have done that.
Darn
I\'m doing it right now.
I accidentally did it earlier. I was well pissed off.

Darn

Never mind.

Now here\'s a challenge - get to Mun orbit from solar orbit, see if you can land, and then get home again! ;P
Munar transfer burn is go!

WHY DONT YOU NOTICE ME I ORBIT SUN LIKE KERBIN

Please H2O, I\'m sure you\'re new to this forum but please don\'t place things in huge text unless necessary.I\'m sure it annoys other members of the forum, including me.

First landing with a simple outstanding view!

Great shot, Lorenzo.

I did my second mission half an hour ago, and intended exactly to land near the terminator for better visibility and scenery... then I chickened out and aimed for the big mare just downrange.

The ironic bit is that I ended up right on the lip of the mare, in a quite rugged area... but the terrain engine makes almost everything seem oh-so-smooth from 5 km up ^^ (Harv will have to work on that ^^)

The even more strange thing is that my fifties-style lander didn\'t topple, for the second time in a row, and just settled down beautifully

Single stage.

Enough fuel for return.

Yes, I know C7 fuel tanks aren\'t particularly balanced for space. Shush. I know I can get that dV capability on stock, I wanted to try land it at a reasonable size before I moved on.

Also, that looks so much more awesome than it would in stock.

Reminds me of the Tintin episode 'Explorers on the Moon'.

Watching Sunspots from below 8)

Look out for the tiny '-' before the height.

214 KM/s at perigee.

Hot DAMN.

(What kind of delta vee does your rocket have? )
That would require about 12km/s delta vee-enough to cancel your orbital velocity around the sun.
Here\'s a couple. Had more, but don\'t know what happened to em.FOUND IT!(Less my moon shots, which aren\'t all that fantastic.)
My first landing on that piece of rock in Kerbal\'s orbit.

My munar ship...

1) Incorrect staging after some upgrade...

2) & 3) The first 'landing' - didn\'t switch the navball

4) Second landing - it still disassembled somehow...
just landed my munar lander, and took this picture

Mun north pole. Kerbin and Kerbol, side by side low over the horizon.

Shame that Bill broke the lander when RCS fuel ran out.

After accidentally lithobraking on my first approach, I actually managed to enter an orbit around the moon on my second attempt. Then I thought I\'d be really clever and orbit at treetop height - hey, no air, right? Too bad about those granitocumulus... Second shot shows the result of my 400m orbit when it met a 500m mountain .
This is my personal favourite... I took it 5 minutes ago from what I call the Riach Platoo.

First 'landing'...has something very kerbal-ish to it.

First successful landing! Sadly there wasn\'t enough fuel to return home.

Lift-off on my first successful flight to the MÃ¼n and back. Very similar spacecraft to the previous mission. Notice the jettisoned winglets/landing legs to reduce weight and the absence of RCS, again to reduce weight.

-most spectacular failed mun landing

-someone get out and push
